intro: Sonerila hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan sonerila, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Sonerila hainanensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas.
